the coming of the one who or which comes doesn’t yet have a recognizable figure

do not give in to reactive all or nothing in political imaginary of the worst, monolithic

“one must forget well” (basically same transubstantiation as) “one must eat well”: il faut bien oublier la mort, il faut bien manger ——love object is perpetuated in being betrayed/forgotten, the one who died must be forgotten
two logics of forgiveness: 1) forgive when asked for (this is the prevalent logic) 2) unconditional, forgive regardless, forgive “who” not “what” (this is scarcely visible)

for Arendt, forgiveness is a purely human experience, which, and Derrida is not convinced, only has meaning where right to punish is exercised; for Derrida, forgiveness has nothing in common w/ punishment, don’t need God to speak of transhuman, ahuman
acc. Christian doctrine, God alone can forgive
there is transcendence in idea of forgiveness
forgive the unforgivable, the impossible: accomplish a gesture no longer measured by human immanence > origin of religion related to this possibility
one should never want to avoid getting caught in a tight spot [re: “Christian” landscape of deconstruction]
Derrida pursues necessity of hyper-atheological discourse, while ceaselessly meditating on Abrahamic culture w/out trying to destroy/disqualify it
Heidegger’s Destruktion has Lutheran origins which Derrida has always been interested in deconstructing, but can one pass through, overstep, this “Christian” landscape?
Derrida wants to deconstruct deconstruction of the Lutheran trace found in Heidegger’s Destruktion; how does one pass, step through

“friends of psychoanalysis”—affirm necessity of psychoanalysis’ future-to-come > consider whether psychoanalysis has yet to take place “up until now” > such a vigilant “friend” affirms, says “yes,” to its “secret” space, which calls for another ethics, law, rigor
“secret” space of psychoanalysis calls for law of other
“matrix” of OG: conditioned all my later work

Derrida follows Freud’s breaches & openings, a reaffirmation of reason “w/out alibi,” goes against a certain historical concept of reason, can even provoke thought beyond “power,” “drive for power,” drive for sovereignty

Derrida prefers breaches and openings in Freud; reaffirmation of a thought w/out alibi: no theological/humanist alibi in psychoanalysis (makes it so pitiless, so cruel); indispensable audacity of thought—courage; use of theoretical fictions [i.e. pleasure principle vs. death principle]
metapsychology—provisional weapon against philosophy of consciousness; all Freud’s machinery (id, ego, superego, ideal ego, ego ideal, etc.) will not hold up for very long
Freud’s grand entities (ego, id, etc.) & Lacan’s grand conceptual oppositions (real, imaginary, symbolic) are too solid, substantialized—differance erases/displaces their borders

psychoanalytic aim > not to seek refuge in a theological/humanist alibi > Derrida seduced by psychoanalysis’ audacity of thought, its courage, signing theoretical “fictions” in name of a knowledge w/out alibi (thus, the most “positive” knowledge”)

[re: psychoanalysis’ method, teaching?] debt of all theoretical (juridical, ethical & political) positing to a performative power structured by a fiction, by figural invention: “the convention that guarantees every performative inscribes within itself the credit that is conferred upon a fiction”
we must always reaffirm something of the past to avoid relapse into something worse
Freud helps us question tranquil assurances of responsibility
“Questions of Responsibility” (series of lectures for a decade or more): hospitality, secret, forgiveness, testimony, now DP
via Freud, divided, differentiated “subject,” not reduced to egological intentionality, experiences against inexhaustible/invincible background of heteronomy
Islam has remained inaccessible to psychoanalysis
Europe is the most beautiful example of auto-immunity, and allegory, because w/ Europe we see auto-immunity as survival, invincibility as auto-immunity: immense tragedy of a beautiful suicide
Europe exports: 1) norms, advancements, language [re: consolidation of rights, laws, to sovereignty of subject] 2) its auto-hetero-deconstructive capacity or auto-immunity
how we proceed as if psychoanalysis never happened, as if we still believed in sovereign authority of ego, speak the language of “autonomy”
globalization is Europeanization
globalization is Europeanization
“subject” instituted only out of “fear” of unconscious, interrupts energy; one ethical/political “system,” one “idea” of Good/Right > constructions produced to resist a threat

motif.title: UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP

content: the charters that govern psychoanalysis are not psychoanalytical

[Socrates] necessary to know, there’s no event w/out some kind of non-knowledge ——event beyond all performative sovereignty, all foreseeability, beyond every horizon (one believes one sees coming) [re: psychoanalytic revolution beyond sovereignty of “subject”]
[re: murder of the father] Freud’s “historical” vs. “material” truth: one based on facts in real archive, the other discernible in symptoms [Yerushalmi neglects the latter]
“independence & contradiction: there is nothing I understand better”

there is a universal “structure” of heteronomic election: I am the only one called to do this or that, irreplaceable in the place of decision, in obligation to respond “I am here,” this election of each gives to all responsibility worthy of the name, if there is any, its chance/condition > also, Derrida is very suspicious of “doctrine” of election, & binding this universal to Judaism
circumcision: someone marked my destiny before I had a word to say > (true for women too, something preceded your Catholicism, Derrida tells E.R.)
against Sartre’s idea that anti-Semitism produces the Jew
heritage of circumcision precedes speech, oath, contract
for Lacan, madness—limit of human freedom
Levinas justifies lex talionis > a “message of universalism,” not a reveling in revenge, seeks only justice
